Package sailpoint.api

Class Localizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.api.Localizer
  • public class Localizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility for dealing with localized attributes.

      • getDefaultLocalizedValue

        public java.lang.String getDefaultLocalizedValue​(java.lang.String targetId,
                                                 java.lang.String attribute)
        This is a fallback method. Returns the defaultLocale's version of the attribute. Used for when we try to retrieve a localized value for a language that doesn't exist in the database.

      • getLocalizedValue

        public java.lang.String getLocalizedValue​(SailPointObject object,

      • buildAttributes

        public void buildAttributes​(java.lang.String attribute,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> localizedValues,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String simpleClassName)
        Populates the LocalizedAttributes from a Map of attributes keyed by locale
        Parameters:
        attribute - Type of attribute that is being populated (Localizer.ATTR_DESCRIPTION, in most cases)
        localizedValues - Map of new values keyed by locale
        name - optional name to be applied to the LocalizedAttribute. Note that the suffix, :: is appended.

      • addLocalizedAttribute

        public void addLocalizedAttribute​(java.lang.String attribute,
                                  java.lang.String locale,
                                  java.lang.String value,
                                  java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String simpleClassName)
                           throws GeneralException
        Create a LocalizedAttribute for the given attribute, locale, and value. Note that the targetId must be set before calling this method and that this no-ops if the attribute already exists
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of the attribute (eg - Localizer.ATTR_DESCRIPTION).
        locale - The Locale string for this value.
        value - The localized value.
        name - An optional name to set on the LocalizedAttribute.
        simpleClassName - The simple class name of the target.
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If the targetId is not set on this Localizer.

      • findAttributes

        public java.util.List<LocalizedAttribute> findAttributes​(java.lang.String attribute,
                                                         boolean checkNames)
        Finds all LocalizedAttribute values in the database for the specified attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - Attribute to find -- "description," for example
        checkNames - true to return an attribute regardless of whether the targetId is found as an ID or a name

      • getTransientAttributesMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getTransientAttributesMap​(java.lang.String attribute)
        Returns a map of localized attributes keyed by locale. This differs from getAttributesMap() in that it won't overwrite any transient attributes. This is only useful when the call has invoked Localizer.buildAttributes() prior to calling this method that were added to this Localizer.
        Parameters:
        attribute -
        Returns:

      • localeValueMapToLanguageList

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object>> localeValueMapToLanguageList​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> valuesByLocale,
                                                                                                           java.util.Locale userLocale)
        Utility method called by resources and beans to convert locale-value maps coming out of the system config to a language list that is suitable for consumption by the javascript-based MultLanguageHTMLEditor
        Parameters:
        valuesByLocale - Map of values keyed by their locale
        Returns:
        List of values paired with locales -- suitable for consumption by the javascript-based MultiLanguageHTMLEditor

      • importFile

        public int importFile​(org.primefaces.model.file.UploadedFile importFile,
                      java.lang.String objectType,
                      java.lang.String language,
                      sailpoint.server.Importer.Monitor monitor)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      GeneralException
        Builds a BufferedReader using an import file uploaded via the UI and passes it along to the actual processing method. import file
        Parameters:
        language - Language of the explanations to be created
        Returns:
        Number of lines with problems (token count, invalid type, etc.)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GeneralException

        public static java.util.Locale localeStringToLocale​(java.lang.String localeString)
        Utility to convert a locale that's been dumped to a String back into its original form
        Parameters:
        localeString - The output of a call to Locale.toString()
        Returns:

      • getDefaultLocaleName

      • buildLocalizedAttribute

        public LocalizedAttribute buildLocalizedAttribute​(java.lang.String attribute,
                                                  java.lang.String locale,
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.String simpleClassName)
        Builds a LocalizedAttribute object from the specified parameters. Note that the value is not set by this method.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute name.
        locale - The locale.
        name - The target name.
        simpleClassName - The simple class name of the target.
        Returns:
        The new localized attribute object.
